item.title: The 3 Gurus of 90s Web Design: Zeldman, Siegel, Nielsen
item.description: With the rise of Flash and CSS in 1997, three web design philosophies emerged. David Siegel advocated for 'hacks', Jakob Nielsen kept it simple, while Jeffrey Zeldman combined flair with usability.

item.title: GitHub Copilot for Xcode - Agent Mode + Model Context Protocol (MCP) Servers Getting Started Guide!
item.description:
If you are a Swift and Xcode developer looking for a productivity boost then look no further than GitHub Copilot for Xcode with code completions, chat, agent mode, and MCP support. I walk you through everything you need to know to get setup and running.
Chapters: 00:00 - Introduction to GitHub Copilot for Xcode 01:04 - Installation of GitHub Copilot for Xcode 04:00 - Code Completions and Copilot Chat 06:00 - Agent Mode for Xcode 09:50 - MCP servers for Xcode 13:40 - Wrap-up
Links: - GitHub Copilot for Xcode: http://github.com/github/copilotforxcode - Features & Sign-up: https://github.com/features/copilot - Monkey Swift app: https://github.com/jamesmontemagno/MyMonkeyApp-Swift
Join this channel to get access to perks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCENTmbKaTphpWV2R2evVz2A/join

item.title: Dapper, FusionCache, and Redis - The ULTIMATE CACHE Solution for ASP NET Core
item.description:
I love working with Dapper. I love working with FusionCache... What better video to put together than a tutorial on integrating these pieces in ASP NET Core?!
In this video, we continue on the series where we swap components to get different implementations in our caching web API.

item.title: The luxury of letting ideas marinate
item.description: This post explores the power of letting ideas sit. It reflects on how having time, space, and a clear mind can lead to better solutions ‚Äî especially in engineering and research. It contrasts rushed patches with well-thought-out fixes that emerge when pressure is low and the mind is calm.
